intro: Kyrstenia angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf kyrstenia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. Its botanical features include finely divided leaves and a taproot system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Kyrstenia angustata is often found in open woodlands and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
